title: AI Fluency: Framework & Foundations
description: Learn to collaborate with AI systems effectively, efficiently, ethically, and safely. Partnership between Anthropic and academic experts Prof. Joseph Feller and Prof. Rick Dakan teaching practical skills for effective, ethical, and safe AI interaction.
instructor: Prof. Joseph Feller (University College Cork), Prof. Rick Dakan (Ringling College)

title: AI Fluency for Educators
description: Empowers faculty, instructional designers, and educational leaders to apply AI Fluency into their own teaching practice and institution. Developed to help educators integrate AI competencies into their teaching methodologies.
instructor: Prof. Joseph Feller, Prof. Rick Dakan
prerequisites: Understanding of the 4D AI Fluency Framework from core course

title: AI Fluency for Students
description: Empowers students to develop AI Fluency skills that enhance learning, career planning, and academic success through responsible AI collaboration.
instructor: Prof. Joseph Feller, Prof. Rick Dakan
prerequisites: Understanding of the 4D AI Fluency Framework from core course

title: Building with the Claude API
description: Comprehensive course covering the full spectrum of working with Anthropic models using the Claude API. Covers fundamental API operations, advanced prompting techniques, tool integration, and architectural patterns including RAG systems, prompt caching, MCP servers, and agent-based systems.
prerequisites: Proficiency in Python programming, basic knowledge of handling JSON data
learning_objectives: Set up API authentication, implement conversations, configure prompts, design evaluation workflows, apply prompt engineering, integrate tool use, build RAG systems, utilize extended thinking, implement caching, develop MCP servers/clients, deploy Anthropic Apps, architect agent systems

title: Claude Code in Action
description: Integrate Claude Code into your development workflow. Covers AI assistant architecture, implementation techniques, advanced integration strategies, context management approaches, and functionality extension through MCP servers and GitHub integration.
prerequisites: Familiarity with command-line interfaces and terminal operations, basic understanding of version control with Git
learning_objectives: Understand AI assistant codebase interaction, leverage multiple tools for complex tasks, maintain context throughout conversations, use visual inputs, build custom commands, integrate external tools via MCP, set up automated code review, apply reasoning approaches

title: Introduction to Model Context Protocol
description: Learn to build Model Context Protocol servers and clients from scratch using Python. Master MCP's three core primitives—tools, resources, and prompts—to connect Claude with external services.
prerequisites: Working knowledge of Python programming, basic understanding of JSON and HTTP request-response patterns
learning_objectives: Understand MCP architecture, learn transport-independent communication, examine flow from queries to services, build MCP servers with Python SDK, implement document management, use MCP Server Inspector, create resources, develop prompts, understand when to apply primitives, explore integration patterns

title: Model Context Protocol: Advanced Topics
description: Examines advanced features and implementation patterns for Model Context Protocol (MCP) development, focusing on server-client communication, transport mechanisms, and production deployment considerations.
prerequisites: Python development experience with async programming patterns, familiarity with JSON message formats and HTTP protocols, basic Server-Sent Events (SSE) knowledge
learning_objectives: Implement sampling, progress/logging notifications, roots-based file access, JSON message architecture, stdio transport mechanisms, StreamableHTTP transport, understand HTTP transport limitations, production scaling considerations, transport selection criteria

title: Claude with Amazon Bedrock
description: Comprehensive training on integrating and deploying Claude AI models through Amazon Bedrock. Covers practical implementation patterns, performance optimization techniques, and real-world application development using Claude's capabilities within the AWS ecosystem.
prerequisites: Proficiency in Python programming, basic understanding of AWS services and Amazon Bedrock
learning_objectives: Utilize Anthropic models on Bedrock, build and evaluate prompts, design custom tools, develop RAG pipelines, configure advanced features, leverage Claude Code, implement MCP, optimize inference, build evaluation frameworks

title: Claude with Google Cloud's Vertex AI
description: Technical training on integrating and deploying Claude AI models through Google Cloud's Vertex AI. Curriculum spans from foundational API implementation to sophisticated features including tool integration, RAG systems, and the Model Context Protocol.
prerequisites: Python programming proficiency, Google Cloud Platform experience, JSON data structure knowledge
learning_objectives: Set up Claude models via Vertex AI, build multi-turn conversation systems, prompt engineering with XML, tool-use implementations, RAG pipeline development, advanced capabilities, Model Context Protocol, agent design patterns

title: Teaching AI Fluency
description: Empowers academic faculty, instructional designers, and others to teach and assess AI Fluency in instructor-led settings. Developed through partnership with academic experts to address teaching methodologies and assessment strategies for AI literacy development.
instructor: Prof. Joseph Feller, Prof. Rick Dakan
prerequisites: Completion of the foundational 4D AI Fluency Framework course

title: AI Fluency for Nonprofits
description: Empowers nonprofit professionals to develop AI competency to increase organizational impact and efficiency while maintaining alignment with their mission and values. Specifically adapted for the nonprofit context with limited resources and mission-driven work. Teaches the 4D Framework: Delegation, Description, Discernment, Diligence.
prerequisites: Access to an AI chat tool (Claude.ai recommended). AI Fluency: Framework & Foundations recommended for deeper understanding.
learning_objectives: Apply 4D Framework to nonprofit tasks, explore organizational-wide AI implementation, address sector-specific challenges

title: Claude 101
description: Learn how to use Claude for everyday work tasks, understand core features, and explore resources for more advanced learning on other topics. Designed for professionals seeking to integrate Claude into their daily workflow without requiring prior technical expertise.
